summary: Simon discusses Scarak redesign, releasing in broken state, and community involvement.
mainText: Simon clarifies his position on the Scarak redesign, stating he likes them but doesn't feel they fit in Zone 2. When asked if Hytale will 100% release under Simon, he makes it clear Hytale will release even if it's broken, with fixes and fun following. Getting the game out and into Early Access would allow for the development team to expand, with shared source and modding allowing modders to use the unfinished content for their mods/servers/maps -- Simon then floats the idea of modding and map making contests with unique rewards.

summary: Simon discusses the new Kweebecs and Scaraks.
mainText: When asked what version of Kweebecs will be in the game, Simon says he likes the new models, with the new Treesinger design being one of his favorites. When asked about the new Scaraks, he says he'd need to see them ingame and talk with the artists, but there's an option for both if they're equally polished.

4: Option for both Old and New

summary: Simon announces active discussions with Riot Games.
mainText: Taking to Twitter, Simon announced he has entered active discussions with Riot Games about acquiring Hytale, thanking the community for believing in Hytale.

summary: Simon discusses Riot decision makers, Hytale's vision under Riot, etc.
mainText: Simon states that some of Riot's decision makers aren't aware of the SaveHytale movement at all, and some people in the industry don't play games or look at their communities at all - forcing him to speak the universal language: money. Further more, Simon says the new vision for Hytale under Riot was akin to Roblox 2.0, with Fortnite-style events - and all gameplay features were 'redone' for sake of perfection as promises were added. In the end, the new vision got zero players, and Simon now believes that an indie setup is the only path for Hytale to be saved while still being *Hytale* -- and the SaveHytale movement helped him feel comfortable pursuing it.

5: Indie Setup only path to success for Hytale.

summary: Simon announces he has submitted his final offer for Hytale.
mainText: In an early morning tweet, Simon announces that after several weeks, he's made his FINAL offer for Hytale -- saying it's 10x what the true market value is, and saying that it's the only chance Hytale has. While he thinks his offer might be a bit too much, he's offering more money to avoid a delay that permanently vaults the game - but he's optimistic and will be relieved/excited either way. Based off his last two negotiations with Riot ('18 and '19), he expects the negotiations to last at least a couple of months. Simon says it's likely a bad financial decision on his part, but he'll only do it if he gets 100% control.
